result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Kessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - Stayed
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA Surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Eugene Gignac and Anissa Gignac.
Allowed to go to residence on one occasion accompanied by Law Enforcement to retrieve personal belongings.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven A Kessler in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Steven A Kessler in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was set for a Pre-Trial Conference and now is Plea/Sentencing Hearing.

10:28 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.
Atty Constable states there is an agreement on this case and states the agreement on the record.
Atty Drengler is in agreement with the plea recommendations as stated on the record by Atty Constable.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Victim notification had been completed as per Atty Constable.
Victim's do not appear in Court as of today's date to make a statement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on both Count 1 & Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statement and provides an updated address.
Court questions the bond being changed from cash bond to signature bond and Atty Constable makes statements on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Imposed/Stayed a 40 day jail sentence consecutive to any other sentence; only if probation revoked.
Placed on Probation for 12 months
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department (imposed and stayed)
Pay court costs which includes domestic abuse surcharge and dna surcharge.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Eugene Gignac and Anissa Gignac.
Allowed to go to residence on one occasion accompanied by Law Enforcement to retrieve personal belongings.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Count 2 -
34 day jail sentence
34 day jail credit
Pay court costs which includes dna surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge.
Money to be taken from bond that has been posted.
Remaining costs to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

20 days to appeal cases.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven A Kessler
Current: 2861 Church Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 05-04-2015)
Prior: 1708 Elk Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Eugene and Anissa Gignac or their residence
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Steven A Kessler appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Constable indicates she spoke with Atty Drengler who indicated he couldn't be here today. 
Court reviews the file. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Constable recommends to reinstate the $500 cash bond. 
Defendant makes additional statements re: bond. 

BY THE COURT: Court reinstates the cash bond with the same non-monetary conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Body Only.
Sent to JR 4/17/15 ks

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:22 a.m. Court calls the case. 

Atty Constable makes statements to the Court.  Defendant has not been reporting to day report.  Revokes their offer for a plea.  Asks for a body only warrant. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  Met with the defendant on wednesday and he did sign the plea waiver.  Did anticipate him to appear. 

BY THE COURT:  Bench warrant.  Body Only.

1:20 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Constable indicates this is set for an Initial Appearance.
ADA Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Atty Constable is requesting a cash bond in the amount of $500.00 with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes a statement on his behalf.

ADA  Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $500.00 with conditions as stated.

BY THE COURT:
Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.
